poem:
**Picture Imperfect**

In the shadow of flashbulbs,  
truth hid beneath gloss;  
a lens fogged by whispers,  
frames marred by loss.  
Yet here on the newsstand,  
the world's eye forgives—  
for talent unsevered  
in the fashion hive lives.  
A click in the silence,  
a ghost in the view;  
shuttered forgiveness,  
a past overdue.
